info.name: REST API
info.description:
Poject paramnters

  • OTDS_URL - host address including https, but not the port.
  • OTDS_PORT - the port.
  • OTDS_TENANT - the tenant e.g. "otdstenane/t1"
  • User - Username to validate against OTDS
  • Password - password for OTDS
  • MGW_URL - host address including https, but not the port.
  • MGW_PORT
  • TENANT_NAME
  • DOMAIN
Note: If DNS names works then update the SGW_HOST in the CRUD requests with the host URL including port from the MGW calls response.

request.description:
Method to recieve an OTDSTicket from an OTDS server directly. Note: If the server uses an selfsigned certificate follow this article to add the certicifate as trusted in Chrome. using-self-signed-certificates-with-postman

Postman parameter(s) for environment
  • OTDS_URL - host address including https, but not the port.
  • OTDS_PORT - the port.
Path parameter(s)
  • OTDS_TENANT - the tenant e.g. "otdstenane/t1"
Request header(s)

Content-type: application/json

Request body
  • User - Username
  • Password - password for the user
Example { "user_name" : "user", "password" : "password" }

Response

An environment variable {{OTDSTicket}} is set with the ticket value from getOTDSTicket call

Method to recieve an SGW from MGW.

Note: the OTDSTicket header is using a variabel set by the getOTDSTicket call

Postman parameter(s) for environment
  • MGW_URL - host address including https, but not the port.
  • MGW_PORT - the port.
Query paramete(s)
  • TENANT_NAME - the tenant name e.g. "strs"
  • DOMAIN - the domain name "test"

Response

An environment variable {{SGW_HOST}} is set with the host value from getSGW_FROM_MGW call

Example response: { "data": [ { "host": "WIN-N35EVTP4FCK", "name": "demoSGW", "path": "", "port": "2719", "secure": "false", "url": "http://WIN-N35EVTP4FCK:2719" } ], "status": "success" }

exec: tests["status of the message as success"] = documents.status.has("success");
tests["status of the message has theme"] = responseBody.has("theme");
tests["Revision id is not empty"] = documents.revision !== "";

request.description:
Method to get resource content from CAS.

Note1: the OTDSTicket header is using a variabel set by the getOTDSTicket call

Note2: the SGW_URL query parameter is using a variabel set by the getSGW_FROM_MGW call

Note3: Note: The SGW should be used from the MGW call, but the machine used for creating these tests have got updated DNS so the host names aren't accessible for the machine.

Postman parameter(s) for environment
  • SGW_HOST - host address including http and the port.
Path parameter(s)
  • CAS_ID - CAS id for one resource
Query parameter(s)
  • Revision - revision, use -1 to ignore

Response

Binary content for the CAS resource

Example response: Some text from a plain text file

item.name: Create Document with no theme ID

exec: tests["Failed to create document"] = documents.message.has("Failed to create document");

request.description:
Method to get resource content from CAS.

Note1: the OTDSTicket header is using a variabel set by the getOTDSTicket call

Note2: the SGW_URL query parameter is using a variabel set by the getSGW_FROM_MGW call

Note3: Note: The SGW should be used from the MGW call, but the machine used for creating these tests have got updated DNS so the host names aren't accessible for the machine.

Postman parameter(s) for environment
  • SGW_HOST - host address including http and the port.
Path parameter(s)
  • CAS_ID - CAS id for one resource
Query parameter(s)
  • Revision - revision, use -1 to ignore

Response

Binary content for the CAS resource

Example response: Some text from a plain text file

item.name: Get Document with wrong document ID

request.description:
Method to get resource content from CAS.

Note1: the OTDSTicket header is using a variabel set by the getOTDSTicket call

Note2: the SGW_URL query parameter is using a variabel set by the getSGW_FROM_MGW call

Note3: Note: The SGW should be used from the MGW call, but the machine used for creating these tests have got updated DNS so the host names aren't accessible for the machine.

Postman parameter(s) for environment
  • SGW_HOST - host address including http and the port.
Path parameter(s)
  • CAS_ID - CAS id for one resource
Query parameter(s)
  • Revision - revision, use -1 to ignore

Response

Binary content for the CAS resource

Example response: Some text from a plain text file

exec: tests["Body has input queue as typeid"] = responseBody.has("inputqueueobject");
tests["Body has default input queue as complextype"] = responseBody.has("inputqueue");
tests["Complex type id is  not null "] = jsonData.complextypeid !== null
tests["Tracker Id not null"] = jsonData.trackerid !== null
tests["Creation time not null "] = jsonData.creationtime !== null

Method to recieve an SGW from MGW.

Note: the OTDSTicket header is using a variabel set by the getOTDSTicket call

Postman parameter(s) for environment
  • MGW_URL - host address including https, but not the port.
  • MGW_PORT - the port.
Query paramete(s)
  • TENANT_NAME - the tenant name e.g. "strs"
  • DOMAIN - the domain name "test"

Response

An environment variable {{SGW_HOST}} is set with the host value from getSGW_FROM_MGW call

Example response: { "data": [ { "host": "WIN-N35EVTP4FCK", "name": "demoSGW", "path": "", "port": "2719", "secure": "false", "url": "http://WIN-N35EVTP4FCK:2719" } ], "status": "success" }

Method to create a resource.

Note: the OTDSTicket header is using a variabel set by the getOTDSTicket call

Postman parameter(s) for environment
Note1: the SGW_URL query parameter is using a variabel set by the getSGW_FROM_MGW call
Note2: The SGW should be used from the MGW call, but the machine used for creating these tests have got updated DNS so the host names aren't accessible for the machine.
  • SGW_HOST - host address including http and the port.
Query parametes
  • Resource_Name - the name of the resoruce including the file extension
  • Resource_Type - the resource type
  • Locked - if a lock sohuld be applied true|false
  • GUID_Format - true to list guides for reosurce attributes, false for names

Multipart - Request Body
To create the multipart/form-data:
Note: Do not set Content-Type as a header parameter, Postman does if for you.
  1. Select Body and pick form-data
  2. Add a parameter "file" and change the type (dropdown box) from Text to File
  3. Select your file via the file picker
  4. Add "Content-Type" parameter and type corrent mime type for your file e.g. text/html, availabe as variable {{Resource_ContentType}}

Response

  • SGW_HOST - host address including http and the port.

  • CAS_ID - CAS id for one resource

Multipart
To create the multipart/form-data:
Note: Do not set Content-Type as a header parameter, Postman does if for you.
  1. Select Body and pick form-data
  2. Add a parameter "file" and change the type (dropdown box) from Text to File
  3. Select your file via the file picker

Method to recieve an OTDSTicket from an OTDS server directly. Note: If the server uses an selfsigned certificate follow this article to add the certicifate as trusted in Chrome. using-self-signed-certificates-with-postman

Postman parameter(s) for environment
  • OTDS_URL - host address including https, but not the port.
  • OTDS_PORT - the port.
Path parameter(s)
  • OTDS_TENANT - the tenant e.g. "otdstenane/t1"
Request header(s)

Content-type: application/json

Request body
  • User - Username
  • Password - password for the user
Example { "user_name" : "user", "password" : "password" }

Response

An environment variable {{OTDSTicket}} is set with the ticket value from getOTDSTicket call

Method to recieve an SGW from MGW.

Note: the OTDSTicket header is using a variabel set by the getOTDSTicket call

Postman parameter(s) for environment
  • MGW_URL - host address including https, but not the port.
  • MGW_PORT - the port.
Query paramete(s)
  • TENANT_NAME - the tenant name e.g. "strs"
  • DOMAIN - the domain name "test"

Response

An environment variable {{SGW_HOST}} is set with the host value from getSGW_FROM_MGW call

Example response: { "data": [ { "host": "WIN-N35EVTP4FCK", "name": "demoSGW", "path": "", "port": "2719", "secure": "false", "url": "http://WIN-N35EVTP4FCK:2719" } ], "status": "success" }

Method to create a resource.

Note: the OTDSTicket header is using a variabel set by the getOTDSTicket call

Postman parameter(s) for environment
Note1: the SGW_URL query parameter is using a variabel set by the getSGW_FROM_MGW call
Note2: The SGW should be used from the MGW call, but the machine used for creating these tests have got updated DNS so the host names aren't accessible for the machine.
  • SGW_HOST - host address including http and the port.
Query parametes
  • Resource_Name - the name of the resoruce including the file extension
  • Resource_Type - the resource type
  • Locked - if a lock sohuld be applied true|false
  • GUID_Format - true to list guides for reosurce attributes, false for names

Multipart - Request Body
To create the multipart/form-data:
Note: Do not set Content-Type as a header parameter, Postman does if for you.
  1. Select Body and pick form-data
  2. Add a parameter "file" and change the type (dropdown box) from Text to File
  3. Select your file via the file picker
  4. Add "Content-Type" parameter and type corrent mime type for your file e.g. text/html, availabe as variable {{Resource_ContentType}}

Response
{ "status": "success", "data": { "sdpermissions": [ "read", "write", "execute", "delete", "write_owner", "write_acl" ], "externalid": "", "description": "", "iscreatedbysystem": "0", "referencecount": "0", "versionmessage": "", "securitydescriptor": "{\"acls\":[{\"grant\":[\"full_control\"],\"id\":\"strstenantadmins@strs.role\",\"type\":\"user\"},{\"grant\":[\"read\",\"write\",\"execute\",\"delete\"],\"id\":\"strstenantusers@strs.role\"},{\"grant\":[\"read\",\"execute\"],\"id\":\"strsondemandusers@strs.role\"},{\"grant\":[\"read\",\"execute\"],\"id\":\"strsreviewers@strs.role\"}],\"owner\":\"strstenantadmins@strs.role\"}", "sizeinbytes": "104", "tenantid": "1BF7A5E6-A7B3-7C49-8069-EEAD5ABC556A", "createdbyprincipal": "strsadmin@t1partition", "typeid": "textfragment", "solutionid": "", "id": "Y3hyOi8_aWQ9ZTMwYzI2ZTAtNDI3Ny1jNDRkLTk0NGEtN2U3Mzg0NjE5NzE2O3Y9MTt0PWNkMmMzYmU4LTIzNWYtMDRmOS0zNWMzLTlkNjc1OTU5MTVkZQ==", "state": "", "locked": "0", "contentflags": "0", "logicid": "E30C26E0-4277-C44D-944A-7E7384619716", "complextypeid": "defaultcasresource", "expiringtime": "", "lastupdatetime": "2016-02-11T11:16:17.710", "sdowner": "strstenantadmins@strs.role", "version": "1", "revision": "1", "lockedby": "", "latestversionid": "Y3hyOi8_aWQ9ZTMwYzI2ZTAtNDI3Ny1jNDRkLTk0NGEtN2U3Mzg0NjE5NzE2O3Y9LTE7dD1jZDJjM2JlOC0yMzVmLTA0ZjktMzVjMy05ZDY3NTk1OTE1ZGU=", "modifiedbyprincipal": "strsadmin@t1partition", "name": "test", "creationtime": "2016-02-11T11:16:17.710" } }

Example response: Some text from a plain text file

Method to get resource content from CAS.

Note1: the OTDSTicket header is using a variabel set by the getOTDSTicket call

Note2: the SGW_URL query parameter is using a variabel set by the getSGW_FROM_MGW call

Note3: Note: The SGW should be used from the MGW call, but the machine used for creating these tests have got updated DNS so the host names aren't accessible for the machine.

Postman parameter(s) for environment
  • SGW_HOST - host address including http and the port.
Path parameter(s)
  • CAS_ID - CAS id for one resource
Query parameter(s)
  • Revision - revision, use -1 to ignore

Method to get resource content from CAS.

Note1: the OTDSTicket header is using a variabel set by the getOTDSTicket call

Postman parameter(s) for environment
  • SGW_HOST - host address including http and the port.

Query parameter(s)
  • Revision - revision, use -1 to ignore

Response

Binary content for the CAS resource

Example response: Some text from a plain text file

Method to recieve an OTDSTicket from an OTDS server directly. Note: If the server uses an selfsigned certificate follow this article to add the certicifate as trusted in Chrome. using-self-signed-certificates-with-postman

Postman parameter(s) for environment
  • OTDS_URL - host address including https, but not the port.
  • OTDS_PORT - the port.
Path parameter(s)
  • OTDS_TENANT - the tenant e.g. "otdstenane/t1"
Request header(s)

Content-type: application/json

Request body
  • User - Username
  • Password - password for the user
Example { "user_name" : "user", "password" : "password" }

Response

An environment variable {{OTDSTicket}} is set with the ticket value from getOTDSTicket call

Method to recieve an OTDSTicket from an OTDS server directly. Note: If the server uses an selfsigned certificate follow this article to add the certicifate as trusted in Chrome. using-self-signed-certificates-with-postman

Postman parameter(s) for environment
  • OTDS_URL - host address including https, but not the port.
  • OTDS_PORT - the port.
Path parameter(s)
  • OTDS_TENANT - the tenant e.g. "otdstenane/t1"
Request header(s)

Content-type: application/json

Request body
  • User - Username
  • Password - password for the user
Example { "user_name" : "user", "password" : "password" }

Response

An environment variable {{OTDSTicket}} is set with the ticket value from getOTDSTicket call

exec: tests["status of the message as success"] = documents.status.has("success");
tests["status of the message as test"] = responseBody.has("data");
